intro: Faramea talamancarum f. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved faramea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural research.
